fr:mainmatter.fr:p: The trivial category is the ordinal category 1. Explicitly, it is the category with one object and no non-identity morphisms.

Let C\xrightarrow {F} Set be a functor. The category of elements \text {el}(F) is the comma category *\downarrow F, where *\xrightarrow {*} Set is the inclusion of the point into the singleton set. Explicitly, the category of elements has:

fr:ul.fr:li: as objects, pairs (c, x) where c\in C and x\in Fc;
as morphisms (c, x)\to (d, y), morphisms c\xrightarrow {f} d in C such that Ff(x) = y;
composition and identities inherited from C.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: The category of elements is further endowed with a forgetful functor \text {el}(F)\xrightarrow {\Pi } C sending (c, x) to c.
Let C be a category and c be an object. Then the coslice category or under category c/C is:

fr:ul.fr:li: the category of elements of the covariant hom-functor C(c, -);
the comma category (c\downarrow 1_C), where *\xrightarrow {c} C is the inclusion of the point.
as objects, morphisms c\xrightarrow {f} x in C;
as composition, pasting along the shared morphism;
as identities, the unit laws in C.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let C be a category and c be an object. Then the slice category or over category C/c is:

fr:ul.fr:li: the category of elements of the contravariant hom-functor C(-, c);
the comma category (1_C\downarrow c), where *\xrightarrow {c} C is the inclusion of the point.
as objects, morphisms x\xrightarrow {f} c in C;
as composition, pasting along the shared morphism;
as identities, the unit laws in C.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: For any ordinal \alpha , there is a preorder whose objects are the smaller ordinals with the usual order.
A category C consists of the following data:

fr:ul.fr:li: a collection of objects, overloadingly also called C;
for each pair of objects x,y\in C, a collection of morphisms C(x, y);
for each object x\in C, a designated identity morphism x\xrightarrow {1_x} x;
for each pair of morphisms x\xrightarrow {f} y\xrightarrow {g} z, a designated composite morphism x\xrightarrow {gf} z.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: This data must satisfy the following axioms:

fr:ul.fr:li: unitality: for any x\xrightarrow {f} y, 1_yf = f = f1_x;
associativity: for any x\xrightarrow {f} y\xrightarrow {g}z\xrightarrow {h}w, h(gf) = (hg)f.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: In other words, the following diagrams must commute:
